intro: Meryta coriacea, commonly known as the rough meryta, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Meryta coriacea is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 3 meters, making it a notable feature in its native habitat.
